node.name: Diverse Pair of Max Matching
node.rich_text:
k-factor of G
Spanning subgraph, such that for every v ∈ V(G) such that Dh(v) = k. Dh(v) => degree of v.
problem: |M1 Δ M2| >= k
|M1| = |M2| (both are maximal matching)
now |M1 Δ M2| = 2 * (|M1 U M2| - |M1|)
*ez proof*
"if we have 2 max matchings M1 M2 in G such that |M1 U M2| is maximum, then the max weight of 2-factor of Graph G = |M1 U M2| - 2 * (n - |M1|)"
then Wg + 2 * (n - |M1|) = |M1 U M2|;
proof> we have 2 matchings in G (M1, M2) let they correspond to maximum |M1 U M2|
denote edges of M1 U M2 in
B23ME1030
